title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.38-39 | 14-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanatimiran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya Chakshuran Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and expressing reverence.

segments.key_quote: Furthermore I have personally heard you promise Draupadi that you would bring forth the head of the killer of her sons.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains verse 38 of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on Arjuna's promise to Draupadi regarding Ashwatthama.

segments.key_quote: an enemy who sets fire to the house administers poison attacks all of a sudden with deadly weapons plunders wealth or usurps agricultural fields you or entices one's wife is called an aggressor such an aggressor though he be a Brahmana or a so-called son of a Brahmana has to be punished in all circumstances
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's purport is explained, defining an aggressor and justifying the punishment of Ashwatthama, even though he is the son of a Brahmana.

segments.key_quote: This man is an assassin and murderer of your own family members. Assassin and murderer. Not only that but he has also dissatisfied his master. He is but the burnt remnants of his family. Kill him immediately.
segments.summary: The speaker explains verse 39, where Krishna instructs Arjuna to kill Ashwatthama, emphasizing his crimes and degradation.

segments.key_quote: Although Dronacharya joined the enemy camp, the Pandavas held him always in respect and Arjuna saluted him before beginning the fight.
segments.summary: Srila Prabhupada's explanation of Dronacharya's respect and Arjuna's duty, even on opposing sides of the battlefield, is discussed.

segments.key_quote: Fighting in a Dharma Yudha is a duty of a Kshatriya.
segments.summary: The concept of Dharma Yudha is explained, highlighting the duties of a Kshatriya and the blessings received in such a battle, followed by a discussion of cultural purification (Samskara).

segments.key_quote: By birth from parents everyone is born a Shudra. But by spiritual initiation one becomes a Vidya.
segments.summary: The lecture continues with the importance of spiritual initiation and contrasts the act of killing in Dharma Yuga with the heinous murder committed by Ashwatthama, reiterating the justification for his punishment and concluding the discourse.
